definition: chain/cable (unit of length: 100 fathoms, about 185 m)/chain (unit of length: 66 feet, about 20 m)/to chain/to enchain

sentences.english: First we got a bottle hooked to a key-chain.
sentences.chinese: 我們用鑰匙鏈和瓶子串在一起。

sentences.english: Three gun-metal cubes dangle from a key chain that you can clip anywhere.
sentences.chinese: 三槍金屬立方體吊着從鑰匙鏈，你可以夾在任何地方。

sentences.english: He hung the key chain on his waistband.
In here we have some boondoggle key chains.
sentences.chinese: 這裏有一些手工鑰匙鏈。

sentences.english: One of my favorite things he brought me were keychains from Canada and a sculpture from Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 我最喜歡的是加拿大的鑰匙鏈和墨西哥的雕塑。

sentences.english: Ln here we have some boondoggle key chains.
sentences.chinese: 這裏有一些手工鑰匙鏈。

sentences.english: It could be something to put in their wallet or something to put on their keychain.
sentences.chinese: 可以使能放在錢包裏或者掛在鑰匙鏈上的小東西。

sentences.english: They can also be used as a key chain or bag accessory.
sentences.chinese: 它們也可以被用來作爲鑰匙鏈或袋配件。
